subject: Pan American Games
Swimming
lead_paragraph: Rio de Janeiro was ready for the Pan American Games after all. The event ended last night without major glitches. But it was not without problems, including questions about some of the temporary facilities and the lack of infrastructure.Rio has officially shown interest in bidding for the 2016 Olympics, and the Pan Ams were seen as a huge test for the city. “Good, but not perfect,” said Mario Vazquez Rana, president of the Pan American Sports Organization. The biggest star of the games was the Brazilian swimmer Thiago Pereira, who won six gold medals (and a silver and a bronze) to break the 40-year record held by Mark Spitz. The American swimmer Julia Smit won four golds and a silver, as did her countrywoman Shawn Johnson in gymnastics. Over all, the United States earned 12 Olympic berths for the 2008 Games in Beijing. Perhaps most significantly, the Pan Ams had no positive drug tests after more than 1,300 tests conducted through Saturday.
